title: Warwick Davis accuses Jennifer Aniston of denying being in film Leprechaun
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Warwick Davis has accused Jennifer Aniston of denying her appearance in the film Leprechaun – and says she should ‘never forget where you came from’.

The actor, famous for his roles in Harry Potter and Star Wars, appeared on the first episode of Sky One show There’s Something About Movies.

Hosted by Alan Carr, the programme welcomed Warwick on to Jennifer Saunders’ team, alongside regular panelist Tom Allen, with Michael Sheen’s team being made up of Tom Davis and Alice Levine.

Advertisement

Advertisement

During the installment, which airs tonight, Warwick revealed that Friends star Jennifer, who co-starred alongside him in the 1993 movie, ‘denied the film ever happened’.

He told the host: ‘She tends to deny that movie ever happen, you should never where you came from.’

Alan responded: ‘Look at her nose, look at her old nose.’

She may deny it Warwick, but she was definitely in the film… (Picture: YouTube)

Alan then continued the conversation further by playing a hilarious clip from the movie, which he, er, amended.

He said: ‘We are not letting Jennifer forget it Warwick, we are on your side here.

‘My favourite part of Leprechaun is the chasing scene and I have made a few changes to it’

‘You shouldn’t forget where you came from’ (Picture: Sky One)

In the clip Alan showed the infamous chase scene although he added the Friends’ theme tune to it as Jennifer tried to escape the scary Leprechaun – and it’s hilarious.

Warwick also spoke about what it was like to play an Ewok in Star Wars.

‘It was very hot and you can’t see anything in the suit but it was quite sweet filming with Carrie Fisher as she was there feeding me milk and cookies to revive me,’ he said.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I also have my grandmother to thank for my movie career as she saw an advert for the film and they were looking for short people.

‘She knew that I loved Star Wars and she obviously knew I was shorter than average and she put two and two together.

‘I didn’t actually meet George Lucas or do an audition. I went to the studios in London and met with a production assistant who said do you like Star Wars and I was like, “Yeah”, and he said, “Do you want to play an Ewok?”‘

There’s Something About Movies airs on Sky One and NOW TV Thursdays at 9pm.

description: The actor famous for his roles in Harry Potter and Star Wars appeared on the first episode of Sky One show There's Something About Movies.
